title: Breadth-First Search (BFS)
description: BFS explores the graph level by level, visiting all neighbors at the current depth before moving to the next level. It uses a queue.
keyPoints: Uses a queue to manage nodes.
Finds shortest path in unweighted graphs.
Can be used for level order traversal in trees.
pseudocode:
1. Enqueue the start node and mark as visited.
2. While queue not empty, dequeue node and visit neighbors.
3. Enqueue unvisited neighbors and mark as visited.
